message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.SI

The paper proposes a novel Bayesian likelihood-free inference framework using a permutation-invariant convolutional neural network to learn the inverse functional relationship from the data to the posterior. This involves leveraging access to scientific simulators to learn such likelihood-free function mappings, which is a common theme in machine learning research. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CV (Computer Vision) due to the use of neural networks. The paper also involves simulation-based tasks, which could fall under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
